Docs.summary: Raises the event for rows that have scrolled out of view.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowsPresenter> class maintains <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow> instances only for data items that are currently on display within the user interface. When rows are scrolled out of view, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DataGridRow> instances become available for garbage collection.
This <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowsPresenter.OnCleanUpVirtualizedItem%2A> method override cancels cleanup for rows that have validation errors. You can override this method or handle the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel.CleanUpVirtualizedItem> event to provide your own logic for canceling the cleanup of particular rows.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DataGridRowsPresenter.OnCleanUpVirtualizedItem%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
